snippet: Federal authorities said they would order an examination of electrical systems in Boeing’s new 787 Dreamliner after a spate of incidents, including a battery fire this week in Boston.
abstract: Federal Aviation Administration orders comprehensive review of electrical systems in Boeing's new 787 Dreamliner after spate of incidents, including battery fire, 15 months after the technologically advanced aircraft came into service.

byline.contributor: Bettina Wassener and Nicola Clark contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Federal authorities said they would order an examination of electrical systems in Boeing’s new 787 Dreamliner after a spate of incidents, including a battery fire this week in Boston.

headline.main: Regulators Will Review Boeing 787s for Safety
headline.print_headline: Regulators To Review Boeing 787s For Safety
